description: Land only simulations using Princeton forcing data and a standard bias correction strategy. As LUMIP land-hist but with princeton forcing dataset. The Princeton Global Forcing data is based on NCEP-NCAR reanalysis data. The land model configuration should be identical to that used in the DECK and CMIP6 historical simulations for the parent coupled model.  Spin-up of the land-only simulations should follow the TRENDY protocol.
keywords: LS3MIP, Tier 2, Historical, land surface, Princeton
rationale: Land reanalysis. Offline land simulations of land surface states and fluxes allow for the evaluation of trends and variability of snow, soil moisture and land surface fluxes, carbon stores and vegetation states, and climate change impacts.

requirements.description: Historical, begin in 1901 and run for 114 years.
requirements.label: 1901-2014 114yrs

requirements.description: Spin up of the land surface model should follow the TRENDY protocol which calls for recycling of the climate mean and variability from two decades of the Princeton global forcing dataset (1901–1920). Land use should be held constant at 1850 as in the DECK 1850 coupled control simulation (piControl). CO2 and all other forcings should be held constant at 1850 levels during spin-up.
requirements.keywords: TRENDY, land surface, spin up, Princeton
requirements.label: TRENDY spin up for Princeton

requirements.description: For the interim period from 1850 to the first year of the Princeton global forcing dataset, the forcing data should continue to be recycled but all other forcings (land-use, CO2, etc.) should be as in the CMIP6 historical simulation.
requirements.keywords: TRENDY, land surface, 1850 to first forcing year, interim forcing, Princeton
requirements.label: TRENDY Interim Forcing for Princeton

requirements.description: Apply Princeton Global Forcing to offline land surface models running the LS3MIP land-hist-princeton historical simulations.
requirements.keywords: Historical, land surface, princeton global forcing
requirements.label: Princeton Historical Forcing

requirements.description: Apply the global gridded land-use forcing datasets to link historical land-use data and future projections.  This new generation of “land use harmonization” (LUH2) builds upon past work from CMIP5, and includes updated inputs, higher spatial resolution, more detailed land-use transitions, and the addition of important agricultural management layers.
requirements.label: Historical Land Use

requirements.description: Impose historical concentrations of atmospheric Carbon Dioxide (CO2).
requirements.label: CO2 Historical

requirements.description: Impose time varying (transient) historical nitrogen (N) deposition.
requirements.label: Historical Nitrogen deposition

requirements.description: Impose time varying (transient) historical aerosol deposition.
requirements.label: Historical Aerosol Deposition

requirements.description: The standard solar forcing dataset recommended for usage is the solar reference scenario dataset which consists of historical reconstructions (1850-2014).  Includes total solar irradiance, F10.7 cm solar radio flux, and spectral solar irradiance for 10-100000 nm range.
requirements.keywords: Solar Forcing, Historical, Solar, Spectral Irradiance, SSI, TSI
requirements.label: Historical Solar Irradiance Forcing
